apiDescription: The bool represents a value, which could only be either true or false. If you cast a bool into an integer, true will be 1 and false will be 0.
bool implements various traits, such as BitAnd, BitOr, Not, etc., which allow us to perform boolean operations using &, | and !.
if always demands a bool value. assert!, being an important macro in testing, checks whether an expression returns true.
let bool_val = true & false | false; assert!(!bool_val);
examples: A trivial example of the usage of bool,

Also, since bool implements the Copy trait, we don't
have to worry about the move semantics (just like the integer and float primitives).
Now an example of bool cast to integer type:

assert_eq!(true as i32, 1);
assert_eq!(false as i32, 0);
